entry.title: DigiDaigaku’s Super Bowl Ad Baffles Viewers, But the Free NFTs Are Still Selling for $700
entry.summary: Some viewers say the QR code pointed them to Twitter instead of the mint site, but those who claimed the free NFTs are making bank.

entry.title: IRS Should Focus on Centralized Exchanges: Blockchain Exec
entry.summary: Blockchain Association Executive Director Kristin Smith quips that "The IRS are reasonable people."

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Gensler Unleashes Critics for Cracking Down on Kraken
entry.summary: And crypto philanthropists this week raised millions for earthquake victims in Turkey and Syria.

entry.title: BlackRock ETF? There's a Token For That
entry.summary: A Swiss company is offering a token tied to a BlackRock ETF that tracks hundreds of big American tech stocks. But you can't get the token in America.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin, Ethereum See First Week of Losses This Year
entry.summary: Crypto markets ended up in the red for the first time in 2023 after the SEC's Kraken crackdown tanked coin prices.

entry.title: Major Paris Art Museum to Exhibit CryptoPunks, Autoglyphs NFTs
entry.summary: Centre Pompidou, Europe's largest modern art museum, will showcase the digital works as part of its first exhibition focused on NFTs.

entry.title: What the Kraken Crackdown Means for Ethereum Staking
entry.summary: Kraken’s settlement with the SEC over its staking-as-a-service product has put other exchanges on notice—but it may be a boon for decentralized alternatives.

entry.title: Bankrupt Genesis Unveils Plan to Pay Back Creditors
entry.summary: Digital Currency Group plans to sell both Genesis Global Holdco and Genesis Global Trading to pay back creditors.

entry.title: Terra May Be at Risk Again—But This Time Is Different
entry.summary: Terra Classic, the network born of Terra's $60 billion collapse, may be at risk of takeover by a staking service wielding disproportionate power.

entry.title: Reddit Has Given Away Over a Million Super Bowl NFTs on Polygon
entry.summary: Reddit’s NFL promo has pushed its Collectible Avatars total to nearly 10 million NFTs minted since last summer.

entry.title: LocalBitcoins Is Gone—But These P2P Bitcoin Exchanges Are the Next Best Thing
entry.summary: Popular Bitcoin marketplace LocalBitcoins is closing after 10 years. But there are other marketplaces where you can buy and sell crypto directly.

entry.title: Congressmen Launch Probe Into SEC Handling of FTX, Sam Bankman-Fried
entry.summary: House Republicans are calling on the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to explain how it investigated the collapsed crypto exchange.

entry.title: LeBron Just Broke the NBA Scoring Record—Now His NFTs Are Flying
entry.summary: NBA Top Shot reports surging LeBron NFT sales, plus sold out a pack drop that could net buyers his record-breaking moment.

entry.title: SEC Chair Gary Gensler Blames Kraken for 'Choosing' Not to Follow the Law
entry.summary: Gensler warns that the runway for crypto firms to register with the SEC "is getting awfully short."

entry.title: Secret Network Votes Unanimously to Turn Foundation Into Non-Profit
entry.summary: The Secret Network vote to set up a new foundation passed with 100% approval, earning support from the current foundation’s sole stakeholder.

entry.title: PayPal Held Over $500M in Bitcoin, Ethereum Last Quarter
entry.summary: As per PayPal's latest financial filing, the payments giant held $291 million in Bitcoin and $250 million in Ethereum.

entry.title: SushiSwap Acquires Cosmos-Based Trading Platform Vortex Protocol
entry.summary: The acquisition of Vortex Protocol also means SushiSwap will be rolling out its services on Cosmos in Q2 this year.

entry.title: Celsius Looking to Raise $14.4M Selling Bitcoin Mining Coupons and Credits
entry.summary: Amid concerns of a looming cash shortage, troubled crypto lender Celsius seeks to find alternative avenues to repay its creditors.

entry.title: China Approves Launch of New Blockchain Research Hub in Beijing
entry.summary: Despite its bumpy relationship with crypto, China is still keen on blockchain, announcing a new research center to study the tech.

entry.title: SEC Commissioner Peirce: Kraken Staking Action Not a ‘Fair Way of Regulating’
entry.summary: Hester Peirce voiced her dissent on the latest action against Kraken, saying that the industry needs clear rules not “one-off enforcement.”

entry.title: Crypto Market Sheds $40B as Bitcoin, Ethereum Prices Sink
entry.summary: Amid another wave of disappointing news for the crypto industry, the price of Bitcoin fell below $22,000 for the first time in three weeks.

entry.title: What Are The Most Important DeFi Protocols?
entry.summary: DeFi protocols are autonomous programs encoded into smart contracts either on Ethereum or a similar blockchain ecosystem.

entry.title: LocalBitcoins Transformed Crypto Finances in Venezuela—Now What?
entry.summary: The shutdown announcement on Thursday was just the final nail in a mostly closed coffin.

entry.title: OnChain Monkey NFTs Double in Price After Creators Put Them on Bitcoin
entry.summary: The Ethereum NFT collection from 2021 saw skyrocketing value after the creators created Bitcoin duplicates via Ordinals.

entry.title: Board Member of Crypto-Friendly Silvergate Bank Leaves for Polygon
entry.summary: The firm says Rebecca Rettig left to take another job, not due to “any dispute or disagreement.”

entry.title: Paris Hilton to Launch Metaverse Dating Experience ‘Parisland’ in The Sandbox
entry.summary: That’s hot?

entry.title: How the Coinbase Insider Trading Case Will Change Crypto
entry.summary: Former Coinbase product manager Ishan Wahi pleading guilty to criminal charges has raised the stakes—but the ongoing SEC lawsuit could have greater implications.

entry.title: Three Arrows Founders Roll Out Bankruptcy Claims Exchange—But US Residents Are Barred
entry.summary: The new venture said its waitlist is restricted for residents in 23 different regions.

entry.title: SEC Hits Kraken With $30 Million Fine, Orders Crypto Exchange to Halt Staking in US
entry.summary: San Francisco-based crypto exchange Kraken has agreed to pay the SEC $30 million and halt its staking service for U.S. clients, the SEC announced today.

entry.title: Rihanna Producer Sells Royalties to ‘Bitch Better Have My Money’ as NFTs
entry.summary: Each of the 300 Ethereum NFTs gives a holder 0.0033% of the song’s streaming royalties.

entry.title: The Hottest Bitcoin NFTs Right Now Are CryptoPunks Clones
entry.summary: Every new NFT network inevitably gets its own Punks knockoff. Ordinals is no different—and prices are skyrocketing.

entry.title: Voyager Users Will Need Binance US Accounts to Get Their Money Back
entry.summary: Voyager and Binance US wrote in a court filing that they expect the deal to close and payments to begin in March.

entry.title: Linkin Park’s New Music Video Is Directed by NFT Artist Pplpleasr
entry.summary: The “Lost” video features the lead character from “White Rabbit,” the anime series on pplpleasr’s Web3 video platform, Shibuya.

entry.title: Celsius Faces ‘Looming Liquidity Cliff in June’, Says Creditors Committee
entry.summary: Concerns around yet another extension to Celsius’ bankruptcy timeline stem from how costly its administrative expenses have been thus far.

entry.title: A Brief History of DeFi
entry.summary: DeFi is inextricably linked to the rise of cryptocurrencies, but it is not solely about crypto tokens.

entry.title: Ready to GHO? Aave Launches Native Stablecoin on Ethereum Testnet
entry.summary: Aave’s foray into stablecoins inches closer as the DeFi giant launched its dollar-pegged GHO token on Ethereum’s Goerli testnet today.

entry.title: Tether Reports $700M in Profits Despite 'Tumultuous End to 2022': CTO
entry.summary: Despite processing $21 billion in redemptions, stablecoin issuer Tether reported that it still generated $700 million in profits last quarter.

entry.title: Tron Launches $100M AI Development Fund
entry.summary: The AI development fund will encourage the creation of applications on Tron using tools such as OpenAI’s ChatGPT.

entry.title: LocalBitcoins to Shut Down After 10 Years of Operation
entry.summary: Citing the “ongoing very cold crypto-winter,” the P2P exchange LocalBitcoins announced it will discontinue services beginning today.

entry.title: Crypto ATM Provider Coin Cloud Files for Chapter 11 Bankruptcy
entry.summary: Coin Cloud’s bankruptcy filing comes as the once booming crypto ATM industry has found its growth significantly slowed.

entry.title: Bill Murray Discusses NFT Project, First Members-Only Event
entry.summary: Comedic legend Bill Murray sits down with Decrypt at his first exclusive party for NFT holders in Oceanside, California. He describes the project’s origins and why it didn’t feel “mercenary” for him to create an NFT-based membership club.

entry.title: gm: Kristin Smith and the Crypto Crusade in Washington
entry.summary: Kristin Smith is Executive Director of the Blockchain Association, which advocates for crypto policy in Washington D.C.—an exhausting effort that Sam Bankman-Fried was closely involved in, until he set it all on fire. Kristin tells Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott how SBF and FTX set things back, but there are still positive signs from crypto friendly voices in Congress. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: gm: Week in Review: Tech Layoffs, Porsche NFTs, Ted Cruz
entry.summary: In our January 28, 2023 week in review episode, Dan Roberts, Matthew Diemer, and Kate Irwin talk about more layoffs in crypto and broader tech (including how Google botched its layoffs), the NFT market rebound and Porsche’s NFT drop (fail or surprise success?), Sam Bankman-Fried’s latest claims about FTX US and the surprising list of big companies on the FTX creditor list, and Ted Cruz’s weird effort to get DC vendors to accept Bitcoin. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: How Web3 Is Disrupting Video Streaming: Myco, Theta Labs, and Actor David Bianchi
entry.summary: At an investor event in L.A. hosted by watch-to-earn video streaming platform Myco, Decrypt's Sander Lutz moderated a discussion about Film3 with Myco CCO Phil McKenzie, Theta Labs BD Head Andrea Berry, and actor and filmmaker David Bianchi, whose Web3 series "RZR" got funding through NFT drops.

entry.title: How Web3 and NFTs Are Disrupting Film: Myco, Livepeer, Ava Labs, Bad Grrls Creative Club
entry.summary: At an investor event in New York hosted by the watch-to-earn video streaming platform Myco, Decrypt's Dan Roberts moderated a lively chat about Film3 with Phil McKenzie from Myco, Toni Thai Sterrett the founder of NFT member collective Bad Grrls Creative Club, Doug Petkanics the founder of decentralized video hosting platform Livepeer, and Daniel Killeen of Avalanche blockchain developer Ava Labs.

entry.title: 'Iron Man' Comic Artist Sean Chen on Marvel vs. Web3
entry.summary: Marvel and DC Comics alum Sean Chen argues that while studios have made billions, comic artists aren't seeing even a fraction of that wealth.

entry.title: Marvel Artist Sean Chen on How Artificial Intelligence Will Shape Comics
entry.summary: "Eventually there's still a human brain that needs to be involved," Chen said of AI being used to create comics.

entry.title: Actor David Bianchi Previews His Web3 TV Series 'RZR'
entry.summary: Veteran actor David Bianchi spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson right before a public table read for Bianchi's upcoming drama series "RZR," to be distributed through Gala Films. The show is already greenlit and will be set in a dystopian future Los Angeles, with Ethereum and other digital assets as part of the plot. Bianchi also conducted two NFT drops to build engagement from fans.

entry.title: gm: Farokh and the Rug Radio Roadmap
entry.summary: Meet Mr. NFT: @Farokh, who preaches daily to hundreds of thousands of NFT faithful, and is trying to building Rug Radio into a fully formed Web3 media company. Dan Roberts and Kate Irwin from the gm podcast talk to Farokh about Rug DAO and all things NFT culture. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: gm: Big Bold Predictions for Crypto in 2023
entry.summary: Will Sam Bankman-Fried serve prison time? Who will be the next crypto company to go bankrupt, or the next founder to see their reputation dissolve? Will we get a new crypto law this year? Decrypt's Dan Roberts, Stacy Elliott, and Matthew Diemer of the gm podcast crew kicked off the new year by trading predictions for 2023. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
